nodes.bodyText:
Wouldn't it have more sense to thrown an exception in case jobServiceUrl is null?
From my point of view it is not valid value and we should fail fast.

That is a point but when initializing the runtime with quarkus, in some step it instantiates the bean on CDI using the default constructor, with no args and in this case throwing an exception will break the startup, I tested it =/
See https://quarkus.io/guides/cdi-reference on item 5.4

nodes.bodyText:
AFAIK the test scope is inherited from dependency declaration.
Though it would be good to declare it here explicitly.

nodes.bodyText: maybe just do import static here as well
if you need to declare a depency version, that should be done via depencymanagement in the root pom.

great point, I need to add this dependency because it is required running the spring tests, but I added the commons-logging-jboss-logging instead and it works fine now, there is already this dep on bom.
same here about using import static instead.
should it be added before quarkus and springboot?

I'll change it to be more semantically correct, but maven during the build has its own mechanism to sort the order the modules are built, http://maven.apache.org/guides/mini/guide-multiple-modules.html, on in the end it does not make difference the order we declare.
